market_summary: XRP at $1.41, down ~1% in 24h with $3.4B volume. Fear & Greed has risen marginally from 11 to 13 but remains deep in Extreme Fear territory. Macro stress persists: USD/JPY at 155.88, JGB 10Y holding at 2.24% (critical zone), US 10Y at 4.05%, Brent stable at $71.90.
thesis_pulse: XRP ETF AUM holds at $1.18B with 794.9M XRP locked (1.305% of circulating supply). Daily net inflow of $2.64M on Feb 25 is positive but marginal — the weekly net of $4.65M shows tepid accumulation pace against $5B EOY target. RLUSD market cap at $1.56B is the strongest kill switch performer at 31% of target. Price has drifted from the Feb 25 bounce, suggesting the recovery was speculative rather than conviction-driven. Two critical kill switches (ODL volume, PermissionedDEX) remain completely dark with deadlines approaching.

stress_assessment.interpretation: Three of four stress indicators breach elevated thresholds: USD/JPY at 155.88 (elevated >155), JGB 10Y at 2.24% (critical >2%), and Fear & Greed at 13 (extreme fear <20). Brent at $71.90 is the sole non-triggered indicator. Marginal improvement from 80 to 78 reflects F&G rising from 11 to 13 — functionally noise. The stress environment remains structurally elevated with no resolution catalyst visible.

kill_switch_updates.name: ODL Volume
kill_switch_updates.reasoning: Still zero verifiable ODL volume data. No change. Q3 transparency deadline approaching — this is the highest-risk kill switch.

kill_switch_updates.name: RLUSD Circulation
kill_switch_updates.reasoning: RLUSD at $1.56B, 31% of $5B target. Growth pace needs to roughly 3x from current levels by Q3 to hit target. On track but requires acceleration.

kill_switch_updates.name: XRP ETF AUM
kill_switch_updates.reasoning: AUM at $1.18B, 24% of $5B EOY target. Weekly net flow of $4.65M implies ~$242M annualized incremental flow — far below the ~$3.8B needed. Price appreciation would need to do most of the work. Status unchanged but trajectory is concerning.

kill_switch_updates.name: Permissioned DEX
kill_switch_updates.reasoning: PermissionedDEX amendment went live Feb 20. Zero institutional adoption data available. Q3 2026 deadline requires 5 institutions — need visibility urgently.

kill_switch_updates.name: Clarity Act
kill_switch_updates.reasoning: No legislative movement detected. Status unchanged.

scorecard_updates.reasoning: JGB 10Y still deep in critical territory at 2.24%. F&G at 13 is extreme fear. USD/JPY at 155.88 remains elevated. No improvement in underlying conditions warrants a status change.
7 funds live, positive daily flow of $2.64M, 795M XRP locked. Structure is confirmed. Flow pace is tepid but not deteriorating. No downgrade warranted.
RLUSD at $1.56B, up from ~$1B baseline. Growth is real but pace needs to accelerate significantly to hit $5B by Q3. Maintaining GROWING status.
No data. No change. This is the thesis's biggest vulnerability.

alerts.message: JGB 10Y yield at 2.24% remains firmly in CRITICAL zone (>2.0%). BOJ intervention risk is elevated. Any BOJ emergency action could cascade through global rates and JPY pairs.
XRP ETF weekly net flow of $4.65M implies ~$242M annualized — vastly insufficient to reach $5B AUM target organically. Kill switch requires significant price appreciation or flow acceleration.
Fear & Greed at 13 (up from 11). Still deep Extreme Fear. Market-wide risk aversion persists but marginal bottom-formation behavior possible.
IBIT daily flow turned positive at +$84M on Feb 25 after -$117M outflow on Feb 24. Volatile and directionless — no trend established.
ETHA weekly net flow at -$44M. Institutional ETH capital continues to exit. XRP ETF divergence (positive weekly flow) remains intact but fragile.
DEX volume data (24h USD, XRP, exchanges, takers) all returning null. XRPL on-chain activity monitoring is degraded.

etf_analysis: XRP ETF daily inflow of $2.64M across 3 active funds (Canary $529K, Bitwise $1.57M, Franklin $543K) with zero outflows is structurally healthy but volume is thin. BTC IBIT oscillating wildly ($0 → +$62M → -$117M → +$84M) and ETH ETHA bleeding (-$44M weekly) — XRP's positive divergence is notable but the absolute flow magnitude is too small to drive meaningful AUM growth toward the $5B kill switch target.
macro_analysis: USD/JPY at 155.88 hovering just above the elevated threshold with JGB 10Y at 2.24% deep in critical territory — this is the most dangerous macro signal on the board. US 10Y at 4.05% is stable but restrictive. Brent at $71.90 is benign and provides the only macro relief valve. The Japan stress complex (yields + yen + trade deficit) remains the primary systemic risk vector.

recommended_probability_adjustment.reasoning: No adjustment. Conditions are materially unchanged from Feb 25 analysis. F&G moved from 11 to 13 (noise). XRP ETF flows remain marginally positive. JGB yields unchanged at 2.24%. XRP price drifted -1% — no signal. Need multi-day trend confirmation before adjusting.

geopolitical_watchlist.status_text: JGB 10Y at 2.24% — CRITICAL threshold breached and holding. BOJ faces impossible trilemma: defend yen (155.88), manage yields, avoid recession. Emergency intervention probability rising.
Strait of Hormuz remains CRITICAL with dual carrier group presence. Russia-Iran-China exercises unresolved. Brent at $71.90 suggests no active supply disruption — but risk is asymmetric.
Section 122 tariffs (10% global) active with ~Jul 20 expiry clock. No de-escalation signals detected. Trade friction sustained at elevated baseline.
SCOTUS IEEPA ruling shifted tariff authority to Section 122 with 150-day cap. Clock expires ~Jul 20, 2026. Congressional extension or replacement legislation needed — no movement detected.
No new escalation signals. Russia-Iran-China naval exercises in Hormuz remain the primary flashpoint. Arctic corridor risk stable at baseline.

energy_interpretation: Brent at $71.90 is the thesis's best friend right now — providing Japan crucial relief on its energy import bill. But this is fragile: Hormuz escalation remains CRITICAL and any supply disruption would spike oil, weaken JPY further (already 155.88), blow out Japan's trade deficit, and force BOJ into impossible policy choices. The feedback loop is dormant, not resolved. Current oil stability is masking structural fragility in the Japan stress complex.
thesis_pulse_assessment: Institutional infrastructure continues to build: 7 ETFs live with $1.18B AUM and 795M XRP locked, RLUSD at $1.56B, PermissionedDEX amendment live on XRPL. But the thesis has a data void at its core — ODL volume and PermissionedDEX adoption are completely unverifiable with Q3 deadlines approaching. ETF flow pace of ~$4.65M/week is structurally insufficient for the $5B target without significant price appreciation. Macro environment at Extreme Fear (13) with JGB yields in critical territory creates a hostile backdrop for the institutional deployment thesis to mature.
stress_interpretation: Composite stress score at 78/100 (ELEVATED). Three of four monitored thresholds breached: JGB 10Y at 2.24% (critical >2.0%), USD/JPY at 155.88 (elevated >155), Fear & Greed at 13 (extreme fear <20). Brent crude at $71.90 is the sole indicator below its stress threshold. The marginal F&G improvement from 11→13 is statistically insignificant — the stress environment is unchanged from last assessment.

bear_case.score_reasoning: No material change from 33. XRP ETF positive flow divergence persists but at marginal volume. Macro stress unchanged. ODL and PermissionedDEX data gaps remain the primary structural vulnerability to thesis validation.

competing_infrastructure.name: SWIFT GPI
competing_infrastructure.status_text: No material competitive expansion detected. Traditional messaging layer continues incremental upgrades but has not pivoted to real-time settlement that would challenge XRPL utility.

competing_infrastructure.name: Visa B2B Connect
competing_infrastructure.status_text: No new corridor announcements or institutional settlement partnerships that would directly compete with XRPL bridge payments. Low priority threat.

competing_infrastructure.name: JPMorgan Kinexys
competing_infrastructure.status_text: JPM's institutional distribution network is unmatched, but Kinexys remains focused on internal and partner-bank settlement — not targeting XRPL's emerging market corridors. Coexistence most likely.

competing_infrastructure.name: BIS Project Nexus
competing_infrastructure.status_text: Remains the most credible structural threat. Multi-CBDC interoperability with sovereign backing could bypass bridge currency function entirely. No new announcements but the architecture is maturing in parallel to XRPL — and central banks control adoption.

competing_infrastructure.name: Ethereum Institutional
competing_infrastructure.status_text: ETHA bleeding -$44M weekly with zero daily flow on Feb 25. Institutional confidence in ETH settlement infrastructure is clearly weakening. Not a current competitive threat to XRPL's niche.

bear_case.odl_stagnation: Critical blind spot persists — zero verifiable ODL volume data with Q3 2026 transparency deadline approaching. If Ripple cannot produce credible third-party verified volume data, the core utility thesis becomes unfalsifiable and therefore uninvestable at institutional scale.
bear_case.token_velocity_concern: XRP's -1% drift on Extreme Fear conditions suggests speculative froth from the Feb 25 bounce is fading. ETF net inflows of $2.64M against $3.4B daily volume imply utility-driven locking is trivial relative to speculative turnover — velocity remains a concern.

macro_headwinds.name: Global Recession Risk
macro_headwinds.status_text: F&G at 13, JGB yields at crisis levels, trade war sustained — global risk appetite is severely depressed and institutional crypto capital allocation typically freezes in these conditions.

macro_headwinds.name: Crypto Winter Signals
macro_headwinds.status_text: IBIT swinging between +$84M and -$117M daily with no directional trend. ETHA in sustained outflow. XRP divergence is fragile and untested against a sustained BTC decline.

macro_headwinds.name: Regulatory Reversal Risk
macro_headwinds.status_text: No adverse regulatory signals. Current administration framework stable. Clarity Act pending but no opposition momentum. Lowest risk factor in the bear case.

macro_headwinds.name: Rate Hike Extension
macro_headwinds.status_text: US 10Y at 4.05% is elevated but stable. JGB 10Y at 2.24% is the acute rate concern — BOJ policy error risk could cascade through global rate expectations and force risk-off across all crypto.

bear_case.bear_narrative: The sweep exposes a fundamental credibility gap: XRPL's on-chain activity shows a dormant chain (96 TPS, null DEX volume, 907 XRP in order book depth) while thesis scores rate infrastructure as ACCELERATING with HIGH confidence — this contradiction alone warrants immediate score correction and partial de-risk. Two kill switches are now at DANGER with zero data and 7-month deadlines, ETF AUM is 98.8% seed capital with negligible organic demand, and an untracked competitor (Circle CCTP v2) threatens to structurally cap RLUSD before it reaches scale. Tactical recommendation is REDUCE_EXPOSURE — maintain core position but de-risk 30-40% until at least one DANGER kill switch resolves to verifiable data.

threat_matrix.threat: ODL Data Black Hole Masks Possible Collapse
threat_matrix.description: Zero verifiable ODL volume data exists for the core utility thesis. Ripple stopped publishing metrics post-rebrand. Absence of data at this stage likely indicates stagnation or contraction. No third-party verification source exists. Q3 2026 deadline approaching with no baseline. This is the single highest-risk item because it strikes at the foundational utility claim.

threat_matrix.threat: XRPL On-Chain Activity Exposes Ghost Chain Risk
threat_matrix.description: 96 TPS effective, 907 XRP in order book bids, null DEX volume, $199M DeFi TVL, $8.75M AMM locked. This on-chain profile is incompatible with an institutional settlement infrastructure narrative. The gap between marketing claims and verifiable chain activity is the widest of any top-20 asset. Directly undermines infrastructure thesis rated ACCELERATING.

threat_matrix.threat: XRP ETF AUM Illusion — Velocity Without Conviction
threat_matrix.description: $14.1M cumulative net flow vs $1.18B AUM means 98.8% is seed capital. $2.6M daily inflow requires 450+ days to $5B target. No single day exceeded $2M across all funds. Weekly outflows of $3.1M occurred same week as inflows. This is product-launch scaffolding, not institutional demand. Thesis_scores rate ETF adoption as CONFIRMED with HIGH confidence — materially overstated.

threat_matrix.threat: Circle CCTP v2 + Stablecoin Settlement Rails
threat_matrix.description: USDC at $35B+ circulation with CCTP v2 across 15+ chains vs RLUSD at $1.56B. RLUSD needs $11.16M/day to hit $5B by year-end — currently pacing far behind. If CCTP v2 becomes default institutional stablecoin rail, RLUSD never reaches critical mass. First-mover advantage in stablecoin settlement may already be locked by Circle.

threat_matrix.threat: Permissioned Domains — Vaporware Until Proven Otherwise
threat_matrix.description: Zero verified institutional deployments. Target is 5 by Q3 2026 — 7 months away. No announcements of any production deployment found. Feature discussed since 2024 with no traction. Institutions may prefer permissioned L2s or private chains. Kill switch at NEEDS_DATA with deadline approaching fast.

threat_matrix.threat: BIS Nexus + mBridge CBDC Interop Convergence
threat_matrix.description: BIS merging Nexus and mBridge learnings into sovereign multi-CBDC settlement. 6 central banks in expanded pilot. If 10+ adopt unified standard by 2027, XRP bridge function becomes structurally redundant at sovereign level. Already tracked as ELEVATED_RISK but thesis_scores rate infrastructure as ACCELERATING — a contradiction.

threat_matrix.threat: Ripple Concentrated Control Over XRP Supply
threat_matrix.description: 36.9B XRP in escrow (37% of total) with 1B monthly releases plus 473M in corporate treasuries. No comparable traditional asset has this concentration. Institutional allocators model supply overhang as permanent discount. ETF issuers face governance questions from clients. Structural headwind for institutional adoption thesis.

threat_matrix.threat: Extreme Fear Regime Shift — Structural Not Cyclical
threat_matrix.description: F&G at 13 with BTC ETF -$117M and ETH ETF -$46M single-day outflows. If this represents structural institutional reallocation away from crypto rather than cyclical bottom, XRP's institutional thesis addresses a shrinking market. XRP ETF positive divergence at $2.6M is statistically insignificant against $160M+ combined outflows.

compounding_risks.outcome: Triple data vacuum: the three pillars of XRP utility — payments volume, on-chain activity, and institutional infrastructure adoption — all show null or negligible verifiable data simultaneously. This transforms the thesis from 'unproven but plausible' to 'unfalsifiable by design.' If none of these can be verified by Q3 2026, the entire institutional settlement narrative collapses into a pure speculation play with no utility floor under the price.

Pincer attack on XRP's settlement function: stablecoins capture private institutional corridors (bottom-up) while CBDCs capture sovereign corridors (top-down). XRP's addressable market compresses from both directions simultaneously. RLUSD's failure to reach scale means Ripple has no stablecoin counterweight, leaving XRP with no viable settlement niche at either level.

Thin ETF liquidity built on seed capital faces stress test during extended fear regime. If redemptions hit smaller funds (GXRP $78M, BITW $34M), forced XRP selling cascades across all 7 products. With only $14M in organic flows supporting $1.18B in AUM, the structure is fragile — a single bad week of outflows could trigger a negative feedback loop between ETF redemptions and XRP spot price.

BOJ emergency action triggers JPY volatility spike, making XRP-based JPY corridors uneconomical. SBI freezes crypto infrastructure spending. Simultaneously, global risk-off sentiment accelerates crypto ETF outflows. Japan adoption thesis — one of the few geographically specific bull cases — collapses at the same time macro conditions prevent other regions from compensating.

blind_spots.threat: XRPL On-Chain Activity Exposes Ghost Chain Risk
blind_spots.suggested_source: XRPL native ledger metrics — expand current xrpl_metrics collection to include daily unique accounts, payment volume in USD equivalent, and DEX trade count. Cross-reference with bithomp or xrpscan APIs.

blind_spots.threat: XRP ETF AUM Illusion — Seed Capital vs Organic Demand
blind_spots.suggested_source: Track cumulative net flow / total AUM ratio weekly. Flag when ratio falls below 5%. Monitor per-fund daily flows — flag funds with zero flow for 5+ consecutive days as dormant.

blind_spots.threat: Circle CCTP v2 + Stablecoin Settlement Rails
blind_spots.suggested_source: Track USDC cross-chain transfer volume via Circle's public CCTP dashboard. Compare monthly CCTP settlement volume against estimated RLUSD transaction volume. Monitor institutional CCTP integrations.

Already partially tracked via supply.escrow. Add: monthly escrow release tracking, net Ripple selling (escrow released minus re-escrowed), and corporate treasury change rate. Flag if net selling exceeds 500M XRP/quarter.

blind_spots.threat: AI-Native Settlement Agents Bypass Bridge Currencies
blind_spots.suggested_source: Monitor x402 protocol adoption across chains. Track agent payment volume by chain. Flag if XRPL share of agent payments drops below 20% of multi-chain total.

Congressional bill tracker API (congress.gov). Monitor GENIUS Act (stablecoin) advancement relative to market structure legislation. Flag if stablecoin bill passes without crypto market structure companion.
Already tracked per-fund. Add: dormancy flag (zero daily flow for 5+ days), concentration ratio (top 3 funds as % of total AUM), and per-fund tracking error vs XRP spot.

bias_check.assessment: The monitoring system has a significant confirmation gap. Six bull indicators (regulatory CONFIRMED, institutional custody STRONG, ETF adoption CONFIRMED, infrastructure ACCELERATING, stablecoin GROWING, Japan FAVORABLE) are assessed at high confidence despite multiple findings showing underlying data is absent, illusory, or contradicted by on-chain evidence. Bear indicators span 12 sweep findings plus 5 existing bear_case items, most backed by verifiable data. The thesis_scores section operates as a narrative layer disconnected from kill_switch reality. Specifically: ETF adoption rated CONFIRMED/HIGH when organic flows are $14M; infrastructure rated ACCELERATING/HIGH when on-chain shows ghost chain metrics; ODL rated NEEDS_DATA yet institutional_custody rated STRONG without ODL proving utility. The system is structurally biased toward preserving bull confidence ratings that were set during a more favorable period and have not been downgraded despite deteriorating evidence.
recommended_additions: Add on-chain activity health score that must exceed thresholds before infrastructure can be rated ACCELERATING
Require ETF organic flow ratio (cum_net_flow/AUM) > 10% before ETF adoption can be rated CONFIRMED
Degrade any thesis_score to NEEDS_DATA if its corresponding kill_switch is at NEEDS_DATA
Add competing infrastructure displacement index — composite of CCTP volume, BIS Nexus pilot count, and stablecoin market share
Add supply concentration risk score to permanent monitoring

kill_switches.name: ODL Volume
kill_switches.detail: Status remains NEEDS_DATA with zero verifiable data and Q3 2026 deadline 7 months away. No third-party verification source exists. Ripple stopped publishing metrics. Upgraded from no_data to DANGER because the sweep confirms this is likely deliberate opacity masking stagnation. Without any baseline, the deadline is effectively already failed — you cannot demonstrate growth trajectory from null.

kill_switches.name: RLUSD Circulation
kill_switches.detail: $1.56B of $5B target (31%) with 10 months remaining. Requires $11.16M/day growth. Current trajectory unverified but sweep identifies CCTP v2/USDC as structural competitor that may cap RLUSD's addressable market. Pacing is behind required rate. Not yet danger because stablecoin adoption can be nonlinear, but the competitive threat from Circle is a new compounding factor.

kill_switches.name: XRP ETF AUM
kill_switches.detail: $1.18B of $5B target (24%) with 10 months remaining. Sweep reveals 98.8% of AUM is seed capital, not organic demand. At $2.6M daily net flow pace, 450+ days to target. 4 of 7 funds showed zero daily flow on 2026-02-25. Fragmentation risk is real. Upgraded from TRACKING to WARNING because organic flow data reframes the entire metric.

kill_switches.name: Permissioned DEX Adoption
kill_switches.detail: Zero verified institutional deployments against target of 5 by Q3 2026 (7 months). No announcements found. Feature discussed since 2024 with no production confirmation. Upgraded to DANGER because timeline makes achieving 5 institutional deployments from zero extremely unlikely without imminent announcements.

kill_switches.name: Clarity Act
kill_switches.detail: Still PENDING with no legislative momentum detected. Sweep identifies risk that stablecoin legislation (GENIUS Act) advances faster, giving regulatory clarity to USDC/USDT while XRP remains ambiguous. This would invert the current perceived regulatory advantage.

kill_switches.name: Fear & Greed Extended Below 20
kill_switches.detail: Currently at 13 (Extreme Fear). Previous reading was 11. Sustained below 20 for multiple readings. BTC and ETH ETF outflows confirm this is not just sentiment — institutional capital is exiting. Not yet triggered because the kill switch requires 'extended period' and the duration threshold is ambiguous. Recommend defining as 14+ consecutive days below 20.

new_kill_switches_recommended.name: On-Chain Activity Floor
new_kill_switches_recommended.trigger: XRPL avg_tx_per_ledger falls below 50 OR DEX volume remains null for 60+ consecutive days. If triggered, infrastructure thesis must be downgraded from ACCELERATING to STALLED.
new_kill_switches_recommended.reasoning: Sweep finding reveals ghost chain metrics directly contradict ACCELERATING infrastructure rating. A verifiable on-chain floor prevents the system from maintaining bullish infrastructure scores while the chain is functionally dormant.

new_kill_switches_recommended.name: ETF Organic Flow Ratio
new_kill_switches_recommended.trigger: If cum_net_flow / total_aum remains below 5% for 60 days, ETF adoption thesis must be downgraded from CONFIRMED to WEAK. If ratio goes negative (net outflows exceed cumulative inflows), trigger EXIT consideration.
new_kill_switches_recommended.reasoning: Current 1.2% ratio exposes that AUM is seed capital theater. Without organic demand threshold, the system conflates product existence with institutional adoption.

new_kill_switches_recommended.name: Competing Stablecoin Displacement
new_kill_switches_recommended.trigger: If CCTP v2 monthly settlement volume exceeds 10x RLUSD monthly transaction volume, or USDC circulation exceeds 25x RLUSD circulation, flag RLUSD thesis as STRUCTURALLY CHALLENGED.
new_kill_switches_recommended.reasoning: RLUSD cannot be evaluated in isolation. Its viability depends on capturing market share against an entrenched, larger, and faster-scaling competitor. The kill switch forces relative assessment.

new_kill_switches_recommended.name: Supply Concentration Governance Risk
new_kill_switches_recommended.trigger: If Ripple net sells (escrow released minus re-escrowed) > 2B XRP in any quarter, or if any ETF issuer publicly flags supply concentration concerns, escalate to board-level review.
new_kill_switches_recommended.reasoning: 37% supply concentration by a single corporate entity is an untracked governance risk that institutional allocators will increasingly scrutinize.

assessment_360.recommendation_reasoning: Two kill switches are at DANGER (ODL volume, PermissionedDEX) with zero data and approaching deadlines. Two more are at WARNING with deteriorating trajectories (RLUSD pacing, ETF organic flows illusory). The sweep reveals three critical blind spots: ghost chain on-chain activity directly contradicts the ACCELERATING infrastructure thesis, ETF AUM is 98.8% seed capital masking absence of organic institutional demand, and CCTP v2 represents an untracked competitor that may structurally cap RLUSD growth. The compounding risk of triple data vacuum (ODL + on-chain + PermissionedDEX) means the utility thesis cannot be validated — and may be unfalsifiable by design. Macro conditions (F&G 13, BTC/ETH outflows, BOJ yield stress) compound timing risk. While no single finding triggers a full EXIT, the convergence of 2 DANGER kill switches, 4 WARNING kill switches, 3 critical blind spots, and hostile macro conditions warrants immediate partial de-risk. The thesis is not disproven, but it is currently unprovable, and the risk of holding full exposure to an unprovable thesis in an extreme fear environment is asymmetric to the downside.
assessment_360.score_reasoning: Previous score of 33 was set before the sweep exposed three critical blind spots (ghost chain, ETF seed capital illusion, CCTP v2 competition) and before two kill switches were upgraded to DANGER. The +19 increase reflects: (1) XRPL ghost chain evidence is new and directly contradicts a HIGH confidence thesis score (+6), (2) ETF organic flow analysis reframes the flagship adoption metric from bullish to concerning (+4), (3) ODL and PermissionedDEX both upgraded to DANGER with approaching deadlines (+4), (4) CCTP v2 competitive threat is new, untracked, and near-term (+3), (5) supply concentration risk newly identified (+2). Partially offset by: XRP ETF positive flow divergence is real (-1), regulatory environment has no negative signals (-1), and some macro stress may be cyclical rather than structural (net 0). Score of 52 reflects a thesis that has crossed from 'challenged but intact' to 'structurally questionable pending data that may never arrive.'
assessment_360.commander_summary: The sweep exposes a fundamental credibility gap: XRPL's on-chain activity shows a dormant chain (96 TPS, null DEX volume, 907 XRP in order book depth) while thesis scores rate infrastructure as ACCELERATING with HIGH confidence — this contradiction alone warrants immediate score correction and partial de-risk. Two kill switches are now at DANGER with zero data and 7-month deadlines, ETF AUM is 98.8% seed capital with negligible organic demand, and an untracked competitor (Circle CCTP v2) threatens to structurally cap RLUSD before it reaches scale. Tactical recommendation is REDUCE_EXPOSURE — maintain core position but de-risk 30-40% until at least one DANGER kill switch resolves to verifiable data.
